description:
Speaker: Nicholas Tollervey

[The Raspberry Pi Foundation][1] receives feedback about the difficulties beginner programmers encounter when learning Python from thousands of volunteer mentors at after-school CodeClubs and thousands of teachers from around the world.

[Mu][3] is a Python code editor for beginner programmers based upon this feedback.

This talk tells the story of Mu: why it was created, how we built it and includes a demonstration of how it works.

[1]: http://raspberrypi.org/
[3]: http://codewith.mu/


Slides can be found at: https://speakerdeck.com/pycon2018 and https://github.com/PyCon/2018-slides
title: Nicholas Tollervey - Mu - How to Make a Kids' Code Editor - PyCon 2018
